total_functions module¶

total_functions.Display(data, num_beams, beam_spacing, axial_samples, fs, c)¶

given processed RF data and JSON metadata, display 2D matrix using imshow

Parameters:
  • data (numpy array) – 2D matrix of processed RF data
  • num_beams (int) – Number of beams of ultrasound beams
  • beam_spacing (float) – Spacing between ultrasound beams
  • axial_samples (int) – Number of axial samples taken during ultrasound
  • fs (int) – Sampling Frequency in Hertz
  • c (int) – Sound Speed
Returns:

null
total_functions.Save(data, num_beams, beam_spacing, axial_samples, fs, c)¶

given processed RF data and JSON metadata, save PNG img file generated

Parameters:
  • data (numpy array) – 2D matrix of processed RF data
  • num_beams (int) – Number of beams of ultrasound beams
  • beam_spacing (float) – Spacing between ultrasound beams
  • axial_samples (int) – Number of axial samples taken during ultrasound
  • fs (int) – Sampling Frequency in Hertz
  • c (int) – Sound Speed
Returns:

null
total_functions.center_data(data)¶

given RF data in vector form, recenter the data around average

Parameters:data (numpy array) – 1D array of RF raw data
Returns:centered_data: array of recentered rf data (np.array)
total_functions.log_compression(filtered_data)¶

given RF data in vector form, compress the data with log10

Parameters:filtered_data (numpy array) – 1D array of RF raw data
Returns:data_compress: array of compressed rf data (np.array)
total_functions.low_pass_filter(rectify_data_set, window_size=15)¶

given RF data in vector form, convolve the data with kernel of pre-defined window size to achieve low pass filter effect

Parameters:
  • rectify_data_set (numpy array) – 1D array of RF raw data
  • window_size (int) – user input window size, default 15
Returns:

filtered_data: array of filtered rf data (np.array)
total_functions.readBinary(filename)¶

given binary filename, read the RF data

Parameters:filename (string) – text string representing the name of RF file
Returns:rf_data: array of rf data (np.array)
total_functions.readJSON(filename)¶

given JSON filename, read the metadata and return all metadata parameters

Parameters:filename (string) – text string representing the name of JSON file
Returns:fs, c, axial_samples, num_beams, beam_spacing
total_functions.rectify_data(centered_data)¶

given RF data in vector form, recenter the data around average

Parameters:data (numpy array) – 1D array of RF raw data
Returns:centered_data: array of recentered rf data (np.array)
total_functions.reshape_process(data_compress, axial_samples, num_beams)¶

given RF data in vector form, return reshaped data in 2D matrix form

Parameters:
  • data_compress (numpy array) – 1D array of RF raw data
  • axial_samples (int) – Number of axial samples - given by JSON file
  • num_beams (int) – Number of ultrasound beams - given by JSON file
Returns:

reshape_data: matrix of reorginized RF data
